description: President Joe Biden’s administration is widening sanctions on the sale of semiconductor chips and other goods to Russia, targeting third-party sellers in China and elsewhere as it looks to further choke off Vladimir Putin’s war machine in Ukraine.
title: US to Widen Sanctions to Curb Chip Sales to Russia’s War Machine

description: Labour Party leader Keir Starmer and his shadow chancellor, Rachel Reeves should leave themselves wriggle room to raise UK taxation if needed, former leader Neil Kinnock suggested, as the party’s current leadership faces increasing pressure to rule out an array of tax rises.
title: Labour Needs Space to Move on UK Tax, Former Leader Kinnock Says

description: Group of Seven leaders will announce moves to deliver fresh aid to Ukraine based on the value of frozen Russian financial assets this week, the US says.
title: G-7 to Announce ‘New Steps’ on Frozen Russian Assets, US Says

description: Mexico’s recent election has opened the door for constitutional changes sought by outgoing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador that would affect the judiciary and social programs. President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum — a protégé of AMLO, as the current president is known — must now decide which of the changes she will prioritize.
title: What Are the Mexico Reforms Spooking Markets?

description: As a four-decade rise in living standards shows signs of stalling, the pain in the country’s most entrepreneurial province is acute.
title: China’s Economic Powerhouse Is Feeling the Brunt of Its Slowdown

description: The chief executives of Microsoft Corp. and BlackRock Inc. will join Group of Seven leaders congregating at a summit in Italy this week to support Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s push to invest in developing countries.
title: BlackRock, Microsoft CEOs to Gather at G-7 Summit in Italy

description: Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire warned that France would be plunged into a debt crisis if far-right leader Marine Le Pen were to win legislative elections slated for the end of the month and implement her economic program.
title: Le Maire Warns of French Debt Crisis If Le Pen’s Party Wins Vote

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, political reporter Hadriana Lowenkron looks at the political impact of Hunter Biden’s conviction. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden’s Awkward Situation With Another Felon in the 2024 Debate

description: The European Union is proposing to sanction Russia’s oil-shipping giant Sovcomflot PJSC in a move to limit the Kremlin’s ability to finance its war against Ukraine, according to a document seen by Bloomberg.
title: EU Proposes to Sanction Shipping Giant Sovcomflot to Limit Russia’s Revenue

description: Bloomberg Politics reporters answer your questions about the wealthy and elite backing Donald Trump’s presidential run.
title: Trump Is Winning Over Billionaire Donors Ahead of the 2024 Election. What Do You Want to Know?

description: Hamas has delivered its response on a US-backed cease-fire proposal to Egypt and Qatar, and one person familiar with the matter said the group wanted changes before committing to a deal.
title: Hamas Sends Response to Cease-Fire Proposal Backed by Biden

description: The star witness at Senator Bob Menendez’s corruption trial endured sharp questioning Tuesday by defense lawyers about crimes he committed, lies he’s told and frauds he’s admitted.
title: Bob Menendez Accuser Grilled at Trial Over Years of Lies, Fraud

description: Canadian Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said he will vote against the government’s proposal to raise the capital gains tax inclusion rate, ending weeks of speculation about where he would land on the issue.
title: Trudeau’s Rival Opposes Capital Gains Hike, Promises New Tax Cut

description: Brazil Finance Minister Fernando Haddad is considering withdrawing a provisional tax measure that has drawn the ire of companies and Congress, people familiar with the situation said, as he seeks to keep the country’s fiscal target within reach.
title: Brazil Finance Chief Weighs Pulling Tax Bill Amid Congress Ire

description: Germany will deliver several thousands strike drones and 100 additional Patriot guided-missiles to Ukraine as part of the latest military aid package for the war-battered country.
title: Germany to Deliver Patriot Missiles, Strike Drones to Ukraine

description: Hunter Biden, like Donald Trump, is now a convicted felon — a personal and political blow to his father, President Joe Biden, that complicates his 2024 campaign for reelection.
title: Biden Plan to Brand Trump a Felon Is Hobbled by Son’s Conviction

description: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg left open the possibility for Hungary to opt out of an aid package for Ukraine after Budapest signaled it would abstain from deepening support for Kyiv.
title: NATO Chief Signals Openness to Hungary’s Opt-Out of Ukraine Aid

description: Emmanuel Macron’s decision to plunge into an election campaign with his party unprepared and the French public shunning him is causing consternation among the very people he needs to win.
title: Macron’s Election Gamble Triggers Chaos and Anger Inside His Party

description: The White House is preparing to pick Christy Goldsmith Romero, a top US derivatives regulator, to lead a revamp at the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp., according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Biden Is Poised to Pick Goldsmith Romero to Lead Overhaul at FDIC

description: Conservatives on the left and right of the UK’s ruling party lashed out against Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s manifesto, saying there’s little prospect the electoral offer will shift opinion polls showing Keir Starmer’s Labour is set for power in next month’s election.
title: Tories Turn on Rishi Sunak’s UK Election Promises Amid Prospect of Defeat

description: The troubled life of Hunter Biden continues to weigh on his father, US President Joe Biden, who’s seeking a second term in November.
title: Why Hunter Biden’s Legal Woes Are Trouble for His Dad, Too

description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis signaled he’s confident European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will secure a second term following the European Parliament election results on Sunday.
title: Greek Premier Is Confident von der Leyen’s Term Will Be Renewed

description: Kenya’s cabinet approved a plan to sell the state’s shareholding in six companies including Standard Bank Group Ltd.’s local unit as the government works to meet requirements for its program with the International Monetary Fund.
title: Kenya Approves Sale of State’s Stake in Stanbic, NSE in IMF Push

description: President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador doubled down on the importance of a judicial reform that critics fear would erode checks on Mexico’s ruling party, saying it could be approved before his term ends on Sept. 30.
title: Mexican Peso Adds to Losses as AMLO Pushes for Fast Judicial Reform

description: The Biden administration is considering further restrictions on China’s access to chip technology used for artificial intelligence, targeting new hardware that’s only now making its way into the market, people familiar with the matter said.
title: US Weighs More Limits on China’s Access to Chips Needed for AI

description: Congressional Republicans plan to meet Thursday with Donald Trump in Washington for a show of unshaken support of their presumptive presidential nominee following his felony conviction last month, according to people familiar with plans.
title: Trump to Get Post-Conviction Show of Support From GOP Lawmakers

description: The far-right National Rally party of Marine Le Pen would win the first round of the French legislative election with 35%, according to a poll of voting intentions published on Tuesday.
title: French Poll Puts Le Pen in Lead on 35% in Election First Round

description: Hunter Biden was found guilty of gun charges by a federal court jury in Delaware, becoming the first child of a sitting US president to be convicted of crimes.
title: Hunter Biden Convicted of Gun Charges by Jury in Delaware

description: Canada and India have increased their security exchanges in recent months over the assassination of Hardeep Singh Nijjar, including visits to India by senior Canadian officials to share a robust set of evidence on the case, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: Canada Shares More Information With India On Sikh Murder Case

description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is fighting for his political survival after a bleak four years for the UK labor market.
title: Britain’s Workforce Stagnated Under Conservatives Since 2019

description: Lawmakers from the far—right Alternative for Germany and the far-left BSW parties boycotted Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s speech to parliament in Berlin on Tuesday in protest over the ruling coalition’s backing for the government in Kyiv.
title: German Populist Lawmakers Boycott ‘Begging’ Zelenskiy’s Speech

description: Donald Trump’s out-of-left-field proposal to eliminate taxes on tipped income for hospitality workers is his latest attempt to appeal to younger voters and people of color.
title: Trump Vows to End Taxes on Tips in Bid to Woo Restaurant Workers

description: The International Monetary Fund says Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s capital gains tax hike will improve the system’s neutrality and won’t significantly harm investment or productivity growth, but his government must do more to boost revenue and tighten fiscal policy.
title: Capital Gains Tax Hike a Start But Canada Needs More Revenue, IMF Says

description: German economy minister Robert Habeck said Europe is engaged in “intense” work to keep gas flowing through a key Russia-Ukraine pipeline as it seeks a solution that doesn’t fill the Kremlin’s coffers.
title: Habeck Says Ukraine Gas Transit Deal Won’t Aid Putin’s War Chest

description: Thailand has issued a draft regulation to reclassify cannabis as narcotics from next year as Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin’s government seeks to clamp down on rampant recreational use of marijuana.
title: Thailand Unveils Rules to Classify Cannabis as Narcotics Again

description: Ethiopia will raise spending by 21% in its 2025 budget, the first since it defaulted on a eurobond payment and committed to talks on economic reforms with the International Monetary Fund.
title: Ethiopia Hikes Budget to $17 Billion in First Post-Default Plan

description: Eric Ciotti, the head of France’s conservative Republicains, called for his party to join forces with the far-right National Rally of Marine Le Pen to take on French President Emmanuel Macron in the upcoming snap election.
title: French Conservative Party Chief Calls for Alliance With Le Pen

description: Russian naval vessels practised hitting targets with long-distance missiles in simulated drills in the Atlantic Ocean ahead of a planned visit to Cuba.
title: Russian Warships Hold Drills in Atlantic Ahead of Visit to Cuba

description: President Joe Biden’s administration will formally propose a rule to bar medical debt from individual credit reports Tuesday, a move that would prevent major health care bills from negatively impacting borrowing.
title: Biden Moves to Bar Medical Debt From Consumer Credit Reports

description: Emmanuel Macron said his position as French president won’t be affected by the result of the legislative elections after a report he is considering quitting triggered a sharp selloff in French government bonds.
title: Macron Says French Election Won’t Affect His Status as President

description: Jump comes despite Moscow’s pledge to OPEC+ partners to cut production
title: Russian Crude Exports Rise to Bring Prolonged Slide to a Halt

description: Far-right politician Geert Wilders said that the four Dutch coalition parties have agreed on the formation of new cabinet more than six months after the elections.
title: Wilders Says Dutch Coalition Parties Reach Agreement on Cabinet

description: Denmark’s Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said she will carry out more of her duties from the office than usual after being attacked on the street in Copenhagen.
title: Danish Prime Minister to Work More From Office After Attack

description: The UK’s Conservative Party unveiled its manifesto for the 2024 election, setting out their vision for what they’d do with another term in office.
title: Conservatives Pledge Tax Cuts, Migration Cap: Manifesto Snapshot

description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak put tax cuts at the center of the Conservative election manifesto as he sought to forge a dividing line with the Labour opposition and turn around his party’s fortunes in national polls ahead of the July 4 general election.
title: Sunak Seeks to Turn Tide on Labour With Tax-Cutting Manifesto

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is keeping some of his closest advisers in place across key government leadership posts, an indication that his party remains firmly in control of the new coalition government despite suffering a setback at the polls.
title: Modi Control of New Cabinet Suggests He Can ‘Manage His Allies’

description: Ukraine has warned Singapore and other nations that Russia could try to disrupt an upcoming meeting of the global watchdog that combats money laundering and terrorist financing, despite being suspended from the body.
title: Ukraine Says Russia May Try to Disrupt Talks to Curb Dirty Money

description: Malawi’s president said Vice President Saulos Chilima, a potential candidate in next year’s election, was killed in a plane crash.
title: Malawi’s Vice President Chilima, Nine Others Die in Plane Crash

description: India’s powerful Hindu right-wing group that helped shape the Bharatiya Janata Party criticized the election campaign for being divisive and too reliant on Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s popularity.
title: Powerful Hindu Group That Spawned Modi Party Slams His Campaign

description: A Russian woman has been arrested in Denmark and charged with enabling a foreign intelligence service to operate in the Nordic country.
title: Russian Arrested in Denmark for Aiding Foreign Secret Service

description: Labour increased its lead over the Conservatives, according to Bloomberg’s poll of polls, highlighting the ground the ruling party needs to make up ahead of election day on July 4 if they want to extend their 14 years in government.
title: Labour Increases Lead Over Conservatives, Poll of Polls Shows

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: US Clings to Optimism Over Ending Israel-Hamas War

description: Emmanuel Macron hasn’t been discussing a potential resignation, a person close to the French President said on Tuesday after a French radio station reported about the possibility.
title: Macron Resignation Report Denied by Person Close to President

description: South African business confidence fell to a 10-month low amid uncertainty ahead of the country’s May 29 election, a top business lobby group said.
title: South African Business Confidence Dips on Political Uncertainty

description: Former South African President Jacob Zuma’s party petitioned the Constitutional Court to stop parliament from convening, just days before legislators are scheduled to elect the president.
title: Zuma Asks Top South African Court to Stop Parliament Sitting

description: Rumors that President Emmanuel Macron was preparing to resign were swiftly denied after speculation over his future spurred a sharp selloff in French government bonds.
title: Macron Resignation Rumors Denied After French Bonds Tumble

description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu reaffirmed his commitment to a cease-fire proposal during a meeting in Jerusalem, as the US tries to gain momentum for a plan announced by President Joe Biden.
title: US Says Netanyahu Backs Cease-Fire Plan for Israel-Hamas War

description: One is a desert kingdom weaning itself off fossil fuels. The other a lush agricultural powerhouse laden with minerals. Saudi Arabia and Brazil are thousands of miles apart, but fate is bringing them closer than ever.
title: Saudi Arabia, Brazil Hope to Kindle Investment With Deeper Ties

description: Pralhad Joshi, who is credited with boosting Indian coal production to a record, has been appointed renewable energy minister, where he’ll be tasked with speeding adoption of solar and wind.
title: India’s Former Coal Minister Tasked With Hitting Renewable Goals

description: A Russian intelligence operative who’s leading a Kremlin disinformation campaign in Africa has helped run influence operations in Europe for years, according to documents seen by Bloomberg and government officials familiar with the matter.
title: How a Russian Operative Worked to Shape Moscow’s Story in Europe

description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Ukraine’s battered energy infrastructure will be the focus of a conference in Berlin Tuesday to help mobilize international support for the nation’s reconstruction.
title: Scholz, Zelenskiy Seek to Mobilize Ukraine’s Recovery Effort

description: Thailand’s government revived calls on the central bank to lower the key interest rate from its decade high and deliver a quarter-point cut at its meeting on Wednesday.
title: Thai Government Pushes Anew for Immediate Rate Cut to Aid Growth

description: The International Monetary Fund and Kenya reached a preliminary agreement to help unlock about $1.1 billion of funding for the East African nation.
title: IMF and Kenya Reach Initial Agreement to Access $1.1 Billion

description: Finland’s Prime Minister Petteri Orpo said his nation is preparing steps to address the potential security risks from Russian property holding near critical infrastructure.
title: Russian Real Estate in Finland Pose Security Risk, PM Warns

description: Premier Li Qiang will be the most senior Chinese leader to visit Australia in seven years when he touches down on Saturday, a diplomatic milestone that may be overshadowed by renewed frictions over investment and military deployments.
title: China to Send Premier to Australia for First Time Since 2017

description: The Israeli town of Ofakim is just a short distance from Gaza, where war has raged for eight months. But it’s taken until now for the inflationary fallout of the conflict to hit home.
title: War’s Aftershocks Force Israelis to Face Delayed Inflation Spike

description: On this special episode of Voternomics, we discuss the European vote fallout, the fate of the Tories and how Nebraska may pick the next US president.
title: What Europe’s Rightward Shift Means for Macron

description: The Conservative government has damaged Britain’s most important trading relationship — and hurt itself immensely in the process.
title: Tories Pay the Price for the Harms of Brexit

description: The Philippines wants top market Japan to cut tariffs on its banana exports as Manila pushes for deeper economic ties with Tokyo and Washington that include potentially joining a trilateral pact on critical minerals.
title: From Bananas to Batteries, Philippines Seeks More Japan, US Deals

description: Indonesian President Joko Widodo has shrugged off concerns about the rupiah’s recent bout of weakness, signaling there may be little political pressure for the central bank to raise interest rates next week.
title: Jokowi Strikes Sanguine Tone as Rupiah Hits Four-Year Low

description: Foreign investors have sold Thai stocks for 13 straight days, the longest stretch since Jan. 26, partly driven by a sluggish economy, weak currency and political uncertainties.
title: Foreign Investors Flee Thai Stocks, Fueling World’s Biggest Drop

description: Half of Japanese feel the nation has a good relationship with South Korea, the highest reading in an annual survey since 2011 as leaders of the two countries try to forge closer ties.
title: Japanese Views on South Korea Relations Most Positive Since 2011

description: Four teachers from a US college were hurt when they were stabbed in a park in China, an event that comes as Chinese leader Xi Jinping pushes for more academic exchanges to boost ties.
title: Four US College Teachers Injured in China Park Stabbing

description: South Korea’s military said it fired warning shots after several North Korean soldiers briefly crossed the border on Sunday, in a development that could further stoke tensions on the peninsula.
title: South Korea Fires Warning Shots at North’s Troops Crossing Border

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. told his nation’s northern army unit to be ready for any eventuality amid tensions between China and Taiwan, while also warning of a “more worrisome” threat to his country.
title: Marcos Tells Soldiers to Prepare for ‘More Worrisome’ Threat

description: Venezuela’s President Nicolás Maduro is willing to sign an agreement to recognize the results of next month’s presidential election despite polls still showing him trailing the opposition’s little-known candidate.
title: Venezuela’s Maduro Ready to Sign Pact to Recognize Vote Results

description: Singapore authorities are demanding more information from family offices and hedge funds while stepping up closures of dormant firms after a string of scandals highlighted cracks in the financial hub’s oversight.
title: Singapore Ramps Up Scrutiny of Family Offices, Hedge Funds
